Getting Started with Public Sector Solutions Trial Org with OmniScripts

Public Sector Solutions, along with other Salesforce capabilities makes the licensing and permitting processes and inspections easy to manage. You can create user profiles and person accounts to store customer information, automate your business processes, and use the Omnistudio to create guided interactions using data from your Salesforce org and external sources.


Set Up an Organization-Wide Email Address

Define a list of organization-wide addresses for different user profiles. For more details on setting up email addresses, refer to our documentation here. For additional information on organization-wide email addresses, read more here.

  1. Go to Setup > Email > Organization-Wide Addresses.
  2. Click Add to add a single email address to a user profile or all user profiles based on your need.



Setting Up PSS org with LWC omniscript and Omnistudio


Before you install OmniStudio, complete these prerequisite tasks.


  • Make sure that your org doesn't already have OmniStudio installed. From Setup, search for and then select Installed Packages. If you have OmniStudio, you don't need to install it.
  • Make sure that you have the OmniStudio Admin, OmniStudio Runtime for Communities, and OmniStudio User permission set licenses. From Setup, search for and then select Company Information. Then, look at the Permission Set Licenses related list.
  • Complete the required steps to prepare your org for OmniStudio. See Prepare to Install the OmniStudio Package.
  • ﻿Deploying the Lightning web components in the Public Sector DataPacks to your org requires that you use Visual Studio Code and Salesforce Developer Experience (DX). If you're unfamiliar with the Salesforce DX environment, complete the Quick Start: Lightning Web Components project and the Lightning Web Components Basics in Trailhead before you download and install the DataPacks.

To deploy your LWC files and activate OmniScripts to configure your org, do the following: (For Trial org this has been already done)

  1. ﻿Get the sample LWC omniscripts from VPL.
  2. Before importing the Omniscript (.json) files in the org we need to deploy the dependent LWC component on the org with help of VSCode. More details are available on the trailhead https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/modules/lightning-web-components-basics

Create Your Experience Cloud Site

Sites are a great way to share information and collaborate with your constituents. Once you’ve created your Experience Cloud site, you can customize the default pages provided by Salesforce at any time.


Enable Digital Experiences


  1. Go to Setup > Feature Settings > Digital Experiences > Settings.
  2. Select Enable Digital Experiences.
  3. Enter a domain name and click Check Availability.
  4. If your chosen domain name is available, click Save to enable your Experience Site. You can find additional information here.

Create Custom Community User Profile

Every Salesforce org includes standard profiles that you can assign to users. Create Community user profiles to help your users to log in via an Experience Cloud site.


  1. Go to Setup > Users > Profiles.
  2. From the list, click Clone to clone a Customer Community Plus User profile, enter a name of your choice, and click Save. For example, LPI Community Plus User.
  3. Click Edit on the newly created profile to make changes to the profile’s permissions and other information.
  4. Under the Administrative Permissions section, enable Manage Industries Visit.
  5. Under the General User Permissions, select Grant community users access to LPI features,Grant users access to Industries Interaction Calculation features, Enables consumers and partners to execute OmniScripts, DRs, Cards through a Community or off platform. and Run Flows.
  6. Now, set object permissions based on your need. A list of all sample permissions are listed below.
    1. Standard Object Permissions
  • Accounts > Read, Create, Edit
    • Addresses > Read, Create, Edit
    • Assets > Read, Create, Edit
    • Authorization Application Assets > Read, Create, Edit
    • Authorization Application Places > Read, Create, Edit
    • Business Licenses > Read
    • Business License Applications > Read, Create, Edit
    • Business Profiles > Read, Create, Edit
    • Business Regulatory Authorization Types > Read
    • Business Regulatory Authorization Type Dependencies > Read
    • Business Types > Read
    • Cases > Read, Create, Edit
    • Contacts > Read, Create, Edit
    • Course Offerings > Read
    • Decision Matrices > Read
    • Decision Matrix Columns > Read
    • Decision Matrix Rows > Read
    • Decision Matrix Versions > Read
    • Document Checklist Items > Read, Create, Edit
    • Examinations > Read
    • Expression Sets > Read
    • Expression Set Steps > Read
    • Expression Set Step Relationships > Read
    • Expression Set Variables > Read
    • Expression Set Versions > Read
    • Individual Applications > Read, Create, Edit
    • Inspection Types > Read
    • Locations > Read, Create, Edit
    • Omni Data Transformations > Read
    • Omni Data Transformation Items> Read
    • Omni Processes> Read
    • Omni Process Compilations> Read
    • Omni Process Elements> Read
    • Omni Process Transient Data> Read
    • OmniScript Saved Sessions> Read
    • Omni UI Cards> Read
    • Person Education > Read, Create, Edit
    • Person Examination > Read, Create, Edit
    • Polygon > Read
    • Preliminary Application References > Read, Create, Edit, Delete
    • Public Complaints > Read, Create
    • Regulatory Authorities > Read
    • Regulatory Authorization Types > Read

componentInstanceProperties.value:
• Regulatory Codes > Read
    • Regulatory Code Violations > Read
    • Regulatory Transaction Fees > Read, Create
    • Regulatory Transaction Fee Items > Read, Create
    • Training Courses > Read
    • Training Course Participants > Read, Create, Edit
    • Violation Enforcement Actions > Read
    • Violation Types > Read
    • Visits > Read
    • Visited Parties > Read

b. Custom Object Permissions

  • DataRaptor Bulk Data > Read
    • Vlocity Datapack Objects > Read
    • Vlocity DataRaptor Batch Queue > Read
    • Vlocity DataRaptor Object Interface > Read
    • Vlocity DocuSign Templates > Read


7. Save your profile.

8. Update Field Level Security for the below entities as per your need. Field Level Security can be set up for other entities too.

a. Click to open your newly created community user profile and search for Standard Field-Level Security. 

  • Find the following standard objects - Business License, Business Profile, and Person Education. 
    • Click View against each object. 
    • In the next page, click Edit, and provide read or edit access to the necessary fields. 
    • Click Save. 
    • Click Back to Profile after setting your access, and proceed to the next Object.
    • Complete the process above to all the objects above. 

b. Click to open your newly created community user profile and search for Custom Field-Level Security. Follow the steps above to set field level access to each custom field. To ensure ease-of-use, we recommend setting Read access to all fields of the objects and keep Edit access as default.

  • DataRaptor Bulk Data
    • Vlocity DataPack Object


Keep other fields default.

Create Licenses & Permits Site

You can create an Experience Cloud site with the Licenses and Permits template.


  1. Go to Setup > Feature Settings > Digital Experiences > All Sites.
  2. Click New.
  3. Choose the Licenses And Permits template.
  4. Click Get Started.
  5. Give your site a Name and URL and click Create.
  6. You will be directed to Workspaces.
  7. Click Administration to make the following changes:
    1. On the Settings page, click Activate. Click OK to confirm.
    2. On the Members page, under the Select Profiles section, click on the Search dropdown and choose Customer. Move your chosen profile, such as LPI Community Plus User, from the Available Profiles table to the Selected Profiles table. Click Save.
    3. Optionally, you can follow the steps below to self register a profile.
      1. Go to Login & Registration. Under the Registration Page Configuration section, select the Allow customers and partners to self-register checkbox.
      2. Choose  a Profile (for example, LPI Community Plus User) from the dropdown and click Save.

Setup necessary List Views for Digital Experience Users

List views help create a scrollable list of records that meet your filter criteria.


  1. From the App Launcher (9 dots at the top left corner), search and open Individual Applications.
    1. Create a new List view by clicking on the Gear icon for List View Controls. To read more about creating or cloning a list view, click here.
    2. Enter a List Name. For example, My Individual Applications.
    3. Choose who can see this list view. If you choose the option Share list view with groups of users, then, from the Search dropdown list, choose All Customer Portal Users and click Save.
    4. Click on the Filter icon to set Filter by Owner as “All individual applications”, click Done.
    5. Under Filters, select Add Filter.

From the Field dropdown choose Returned to Applicant.

Choose the Operator value as equals.

Set the Value as False.

﻿Click Done.

Save the filter.

componentInstanceProperties.value: true

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
f. Repeat the process above to create another list view for Returned Applications

Sample name - My Returned Individual Applications.

Set Filter by Owner as All individual applications.

Set filter values - Returned to Applicant equals True.

Click Done.

Save the filter.

2. From the App Launcher (9 dots at the top left corner), search and open Business License Applications.

a. Follow the steps as listed above for Individual Applications to create list views for Business License Applications.

b. Sample name - My Business Applications

Set Filter by Owner as All business license applications and click Done. Save the filter.

Add a new filter and set filter values - Returned to Applicant equals False.

Click Done.

Save the filter.

c. Sample name - My Returned Business Applications

Set Filter by Owner as All business license applications and click Done. Save the filter.

Add a new filter and set filter values - Returned to Applicant equals True.

Click Done.

Save the filter.

3. From the App Launcher (9 dots at the top left corner), search and open Preliminary Application References.

  1. Follow the steps as listed above for Individual Applications to create list views for Preliminary Application References.
    1. Sample name - Draft Applications

Set Filter by Owner as All preliminary application references and click Done. Save the filter.

Add a new filter and set filter values - Application Type equals Business License Application and Individual Application. Click Done. Save the filter.

Add a new filter and set filter values - Is Submitted equals False.

Click Done.

Save the filter.


b. Sample name - Draft Assessments

Set Filter by Owner as All preliminary application references and click Done. Save the filter.

Add a new filter and set filter values - Application Type equals License Requirement Assessment. 

Click Done.

Save the filter.


4.From the App Launcher (9 dots at the top left corner), search and open Public Complaints.

a. Follow the steps as listed above for Individual Applications to create list views for Public Complaints

b. Sample name - My Complaints

Set Filter by Owner as All public complaints and click Done. 

Save the filter.

Licenses & Permits Experience Setup

Configure and set up your site to give your constituents easy access to view records.


  1. Go to Setup > Feature Settings > Digital Experiences > All Sites.
  2. Choose the new Experience Site created by you and click Builder. For more additional information on customizing Sites with Experience Builder, click here.
  3. Click Preview (the eye icon at the top right corner). Go to License and Permits > Assess Your License or Permit Needs.
    1. Click Back to Builder on the top right corner.
    2. Click Components [the lightning bolt component at the top left corner]. From the Custom Components dropdown, drag and drop the LWC LicensingAndPermitting/Prescreening component to the content area.
  4. Click Preview. Go to License and Permits -> Apply for a License or Permit.
    1. Click Back to Builder on the top right corner.
    2. Click Components [the lightning bolt component at the top left corner]. From the Custom Components dropdown, drag and drop the LWC LicensingAndPermitting/BusinessLicenseApplication component to the content area.
  5. Add a new Standard page to your Experience Cloud Site. For more help on adding a new page, click here. 
    1. Click Components [the lightning bolt component at the top left corner]. From the Custom Components dropdown, drag and drop the LWC LicensingAndPermitting/NewDoctorsLicense component to the content area.

componentInstanceProperties.name: decorate
componentInstanceProperties.value: true

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
b. In the Edit Default Navigation screen, click Add Menu Item. Give your menu item a Name [For example, Apply for an Individual License or Permit], set the Type as Site Page and Page as the New Page created.

c. Drag and drop this newly created menu item under License and Permits menu item.

6. Similarly, add additional pages to your License/Permit Application OmniScripts.

7. Click Preview. Go to Complaints and License Holder Search > Search for License or Permit Holder.

a. Click Back to Builder on the top right corner.

b. Click Components [the lightning bolt component at the top left corner]. From the Custom Components dropdown, drag and drop the LWC LicensingAndPermitting/LicenseSearch component to the content area.

8. Click Preview. Go to Complaints and License Holder Search > File a Complaint.

a. Click Back to Builder on the top right corner.

b. Click Components [the lightning bolt component at the top left corner]. From the Custom Components dropdown, drag and drop the LWC LicensingAndPermitting/PublicComplaint component to the content area.

9. Click Preview. Go to My Dashboard > View License and Permit Status.

a. Click Back to Builder on the top right corner.

b. Click Components [the lightning bolt component at the top left corner]. From the Content dropdown, drag and drop the Tabs component to the content area.

c. In the Tabs dialog, add five tabs. Click on each tab and enter the following names - Licenses and Permits, Business Applications, Individual Applications, Draft Applications, and Draft Assessments.

d. Choose the Licenses and Permits tab.( LWC version flex card will be available on VPL in Summer’22) 

e. Choose the Business Applications tab.

  • Click Components. From the Records dropdown, drag and drop the Record List component to the content area.
    • In the Record List dialog, enter the following information:
      • Object Name - Business License Application
      • Filter Name - My Business Applications
      • Choose other options based on your preference
  • In a similar manner, drag and drop another Record List into the content area and enter the following information:

Setup Sharing Settings

Configure and set up your organization’s sharing settings. These settings specify the level of access your users have to each others’ data.


  1. Go to Setup > Security > Sharing Settings.
  2. Click Edit to change the organization-wide default settings.
  3. Below is Sample Sharing Settings. This can be achieved in multiple ways, below data is just a sample
    1. Account and Contact > Public Read/Write [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    2. Asset > Controlled by Parent [Internal], Controlled by Parent [External]
    3. Case > Public Read/Write/Transfer [Internal], Private [External]
    4. User > Public Read Only [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    5. Activity > Controlled by Parent [Internal]
    6. Action Plan > Public Read/Write [Internal], Private [External]
    7. Action Plan Template > Public Read/Write [Internal], Private [External]
    8. Assessment Indicator Definition > Public Read/Write [Internal], Private [External]
    9. Assessment Indicator Value > Public Read/Write [Internal], Private [External]
    10. Assessment Task > Public Read/Write [Internal], Private [External]
    11. Assessment Task Definition > Public Read/Write [Internal], Private [External]
    12. Authorization Application Asset > Public Read/Write [Internal], Private [External]
    13. Authorization Application Place > Public Read/Write [Internal], Private [External]
    14. Business License > Public Read Only [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    15. Business License Application > Public Read/Write [Internal], Private [External]
    16. Business Regulatory Authorization Type Dependency > Public Read Only [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    17. Business Type > Public Read Only [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    18. Course Offering > Public Read Only [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    19. Decision Matrix > Public Read/Write [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    20. Document Checklist Item > Public Read/Write [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    21. Examination > Public Read Only [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    22. Expression Set > Public Read/Write [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    23. Individual Application > Public Read/Write [Internal], Private [External]
    24. Inspection Type > Public Read Only [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    25. Location > Public Read Only [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    26. Multiparty Information Authorization Request > Public Read/Write [Internal], Public Read/Write [External]
    27. Omni DataPack > Public Read/Write [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    28. Omni Data Transformation > Public Read/Write [Internal], Public Read Only [External]
    29. Omni Electronic Signature Template > Public Read/Write [Internal], Public Read Only [External]

Create Action Plan Template

Create action plan templates with different sets of tasks.


  1. From the App Launcher, find and open Action Plan Templates, and then click New.
  2. Enter a name and description for the template. For example, Salon Establishment License Template.
  3. Select the Action Plan Type as Visit Execution.
  4. Set Target Object as Visit.
  5. Click Save to create a draft Action Plan Template.
  6. Under the Assessment Task Definition section, click the Add Assessment Task Definition button.
  7. In the Add Assessment Task Definition dialog, choose a previously created assessment task definition. For example, chooseSalon Health and Safety - Building Standards
  8. Set the Display Order as 1 and click Save.

Note: If you don’t provide a display order number sequence, it is automatically set to 0.

  1. You can add additional assessment task definitions, tasks, signature tasks to the template. After you’ve added your chosen items, click Publish Template.

Creating Additional Users and Assigning Permission Sets

  • You can create users for various roles and profiles based on your organization’s needs. This trial org has some sample roles and profiles for Compliance Officer, Intake Officer, Inspection Manager, and Inspector.
  • For users to access and perform actions, permission sets will need to be assigned. To learn more about assigning permissions, click here.
  • The below mentioned permission sets are recommended to access all Public Sector entities.
    • Public Sector Access
    • Industries Visit
    • ActionPlans
  • The below mentioned permission sets are suggested to be added if you need access to Inspection-related entities and limited access to other Public Sector entities.
    • Public Sector Field Access
    • Industries Visit
    • ActionPlans
  • To explore Salesforce Maps, which is part of this trial but will not be included as part of Public Sector Solutions, you will need to set permission to your users. You can read more about it here.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Important Note for Apply Business Authorization OmniScript

  • The Omniscript provided in the trial is an example script, it is configured to work only for a single flow. You will need to configure other flows as per your need. The Community User should be a Person Account that is linked to a Business Account. To try this OmniScript, use the data detailed below if you want to submit Business Applications as a Business Owner from the Experience Cloud Site. 
    • Industry > Personal Care Services
    • Business Activity > Beauty Salon
    • Authorization Category > License
    • Authorization Type > Salon Establishment License
  • This detail is controlled in the step "exprShowMinnesotaSalonLicenceApplication" in the OmniScript Configuration.
  • To trigger fees on creation of a Violation Enforcement action with the provided example, set the Violation Type of the parent Regulatory Code Violation as Failure to have the shop properly ventilated.
